About

Issue & Solution

Issue: There is no standard way for style and pass JS to the CKEDITOR from current Drupal Theme

Solution:

CKEDITOR Helper provides hooks, wraps along anything else for making your Drupal theme look seamless in CKEditor

About

The CKeditor Helper was developed to make it easy incorporate your theme styles and front end widget functionality into CKEditor for Drupal. In the following are list of main features:

  1. provides hooks to pass styles, js scripts, js inlines along many other things
  2. provides way to pass layouts for any region of your theme
  3. Includes around 25 free most popular CKEDITOR plugins

Installation

Dependencies

In the following are dependencies:

  • DesignsSquare CKEditor Widget
  • Drupal CKeditor module

Steps For Installation

In the following are steps to install CKeditor Helper

  1. Enabale CKEDITOR
  2. Copy "ckeditor" directory from "DesignsSquare CKEditor Widget" module "library" directory to the sites/all/library/ckeditor directory
  3. Enable module - "DesignsSquare CKEditor Widget"

Hooks

Hook Overview

In the following are hooks provided to pass css styles, js scripts, js inline code,etc all for making CKEditor seamless experience for users

Hook API Arguments Element Description
HOOK_ckeditor_js_scripts_alter(&$js_scripts, $vars) $js_scripts:ARRAY[N]['path']:STRING(path to directory of js script)
$js_scripts:ARRAY[N]['options']['scope']:STRING(i.e. footer, header,etc)
$js_scripts:ARRAY[N]['options']['type']:STRING(i.e. inline,file,etc)
$vars:ARRAY(the $vars variable from HOOK_preprocess_page)
 JS Scripts for passing js scripts to import in editor. Note: first has to be jQuery lib
HOOK_ckeditor_js_inline_alter(&$js_inline, $vars) $js_inline:ARRAY[N][]:STRING(inline js code)
$vars:ARRAY(the $vars variable from HOOK_preprocess_page)
 JS Inline Code for passing js inline code appended last to execute
HOOK_ckeditor_wrap_alter(&$wraps, $vars, $region) $wraps:[prefix]:STRING(html tags before the editable content for particular regions)
$wraps:[postfix]:STRING(html tags after the editable content for particular regions)
$region:STRING(the name of region)
$vars:ARRAY(the $vars variable from HOOK_preprocess_page)
 HTML layuout for Regions passing html layout before and after the particular region
HOOK_ckeditor_body_class_alter(&$body_class, $vars) $body_class:STRING(body tag classes within spaces between)
$vars:ARRAY(the $vars variable from HOOK_preprocess_page)
 body tag classes passing class values to the body tag
HOOK_ckeditor_css_alter(&$css_scripts, $vars) $css_scripts[N][]:STRING(path to css style file)
$vars:ARRAY(the $vars variable from HOOK_preprocess_page)
 CSS Styles list of css styles to import into the editor
HOOK_ckeditor_clean_elements_alter(&$desposable_elements, $vars){ $desposable_elements[N][id]:STRING(reference for the element used for jQuery selector i.e ".calendar","div#calendar",etc)
$desposable_elements[N][remove]:STRING(with potential values - 'content','element','attr' that determines if element, or its content or attributes are removed )
$desposable_elements[N][attr]:ARRAY(this only applies if 'remove' specifies 'attr' and it tells which attributes to perform action on such as remove)
$desposable_elements[N][attr][N]:STRING(the name of attribute)
$vars:ARRAY(the $vars variable from HOOK_preprocess_page)
 DOM Elements list of references to the DOM elements that content needs be removed on clean up

Wraps

when the editor is loading some block within a valid region from current Drupal theme, then it needs the html layout before and after loaded as well to style accordingly. To do so, you will have to specify and supply these html wraps via hook HOOK_ckeditor_wrap_alter(&$wraps, $vars) where the $wraps array contains the 'prefix' and 'postfix' with the layout html to load before and after accordingly. Here is an example:
function designssquare_com_theme_metronic_ckeditor_wrap_alter(&$content_wrap, $vars, $region){
$prefix = '';
$postfix = '';

switch ($region) {
case 'header':
$prefix = '

    ';
    $postfix = '
';
break;
//other regions
case 'main': //main content
$prefix = '
';
$postfix = '
';
break;
}
$content_wrap['prefix'] = $prefix;
$content_wrap['postfix'] = $postfix;
}

Here, we switch based on the region and then set the html tags that goes before the region at "prefix" index and the html tags that goes after the region are set at 'postfix' index

IMPORTANT: Make sure you add class name "ckeditor-wrapper-end" at the last html tag as demonstrated above, so the mechanism knows what needs to be removed before saving content

if you need the name of block, that it is set at the $vars['block-name']

Disposable Elements

Often times when JS widgets are loaded, it populates the DOM with new elements, attributes,etc all of which need to be removed before saving, so it can correctly load the next time editor is opened. To clean out these disposable elements, use hook_clean_elements_alter(). Here is an example as following

function HOOK_ckeditor_clean_elements_alter(&$desposable_elements, $vars){(){
$desposable_elements[] = array('id' => '#calendar', 'remove' => 'content');
$desposable_elements[] = array('id' => '.vmaps', 'remove' => 'content');
$desposable_elements[] = array('id' => '[class^=slimScroll]', 'remove' => 'element');
$desposable_elements[] = array('id' => '.scroller', 'remove' => 'attr', 'attr' =>array('data-initialized'));
}

In the following example, we remove all the content for the element with id "calendar" so does for elements with class name "vmaps". Then we remove element with id class '^=slimScroll' while keeping the content. At last, we remove an attribute - data-initialized from elements with class 'scroller'
